meanings.definition: In a way that relates to or involves a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The reaction proceeded catalytically, thanks to the added substance.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed how the catalyst worked catalytically in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The catalyst decided to take a day off, leaving the reaction to proceed catalytically.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement acted as a catalyst, catalytically boosting his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The catalyst's role was to act catalytically, initiating change in the system.

meanings.definition: In a way that speeds up a chemical reaction without being consumed in the process.
meanings.sent1: The enzyme catalytically increased the rate of the reaction.
meanings.sent2: The catalyst worked catalytically to accelerate the chemical process.
meanings.sent3: The potion was so powerful that it catalytically turned the liquid into a solid in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a catalyst, catalytically igniting a chain reaction of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The catalyst functioned catalytically, rapidly transforming the compounds.
